body.p:
Danville Oct 18th 1864
E. L. Vanwinkle Esqr
Dr Sir

You will oblige me and render a lasting service to a poor man by presenting the enclosed Petition to His Excellency the Gov and prevailing on him to grant it. The statements made in the Petition are I am informed true
I assure you according to my information that this is a hard case
The man could have multiplied names without number almost; but I told him it was not necessary
I rely upon you to appeal to the Gov in his behalf, for he is a very Poor man indeed
If you can, consistant with your opinions on such matters, present this, I will be obliged, and the applicant your life time friend
Write me immediately the result of the application for the term on the Bond is amost Expired
Govr I petition for Felixs man
